page.title: 01BREDON HILL AREA
page.content: The area covered by this survey is dominated by the South Eastern side of the unique Cotswolds outcrop known as {Bredon Hill.}Nestling at it's base are two villages and three hamlets, which are surveyed elsewhere. Predominately rural, the lower slopes of the hill are under cultivation, whilst the steeper grades offer grazing for sheep and cows together with cover for various forms of wildlife including rabbits, badgers, stoats, weasels, foxes, hares and various species of mice. Deer are sometimes seen in the wooded areas. Free food is available in the form of blackberries, crab apples, cob nuts, sloes, elderberries, mushrooms and wild strawberries. Numerous springs rise on the hill and some housholders have tapped this source of clear fresh water to their advantage.
